CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 26, 1961, pg. 4, reads: "HEAD INTEGRATED UNION -Officers of Local 13993, District 50, United Mine Workers' 200-member union of white and Negro Peoples Cab Drivers have as their officers, left to right: Thomas H. Dargan, vice president; Fletcher Hughey Jr., president; Charles Britt Jr., treasurer; Sammy Corbin, right, chairman of the public relations committee. All union officers are colored except Mrs. Adda Ega, the secretary.  Hughey is the first elected Negro president of the local.  At one time, Corbin served as president pro temp, an appointive role. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Union officers, some wearing Peoples Cab Company hats, from left: Thomas H. Dargan, Fletcher Hughey Jr., Charles Britt Jr., and Sammy Corbin posed possibly in Pittsburgh Courier offices
